medical_history.chief_complaint: Agitation and delirium in a 9-year-old boy.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began suddenly; he was reported to be confused and hallucinating about seeing creatures in his surroundings. Duration of symptoms was acute upon admission, with noted confusion, agitation, and fright. Factors leading to symptoms included sustained alcohol consumption over the past three years.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Joe's father is a chronic alcoholic. His mother died of cancer at age 25 when Joe was 6 years old. Joe exhibited irregular school attendance and past behaviors indicative of possible alcohol use, including staggering and forgetfulness.
medical_history.family_history: Joe's father is a chronic alcoholic. No other relevant family history specified.
medical_history.social_history: Joe lived alone with his father, who reportedly kept alcoholic beverages available at home. His drinking began at a young age, and he had been consuming alcohol with his father.
